author: S P
text:
With the corporation proposed to spend 40 per cent of its total income in 2016-17 towards its employees’ salary and pension, it is left with mere 1.9 per cent for projects.

The budget estimated expenditure at Rs. 147.20 crore for 2016-17 other than capital expenditure.

The major expense goes for employees’ salary (Rs. 58.70 crore), pension benefits (Rs. 18.95 crore), administrative expenses (Rs. 26.55 crore), operating expenses (Rs. 22.10 crore), repairs and maintenance expenses (Rs. 8.34 crore) and projects (Rs. 2.80 crore). Thus, of the total Rs. 147.20 crore proposed expenditure, the corporation would be spending Rs. 77.65 crore on salary and pension for its employees. The corporation had spent Rs. 51.96 crore for salary in 2014-15, Rs. 52.02 crore in 2015-16 while it had spent Rs. 14.80 crore and Rs. 14.37 crore pensions in 2014-15 and 2015-16 respectively. s per the budget proposals, for every 100 paise earned by the corporation, 39.88 paise would be spent for employees’ salary, 18.04 paise for administration, 16.68 paise for operations, 11.30 paise for pension and 1.91 paise towards projects.

The total income is expected to be at Rs. 455.83 crore while the total expenditure is expected to be at Rs. 461.77 crore for 2016-17.
